news.title: Country Garden wins bank creditor group's support for offshore debt overhaul
news.para: Country Garden, grappling with a significant debt crisis after defaulting on $11 billion in offshore bonds, has secured an agreement with a core group of bank creditors holding 49% of its offshore debt. This marks progress in its $14.1 billion restructuring plan, aiming to reduce its offshore debt burden by 78%.

news.title: SC refuses to extend time granted to DHFL's former promoter to surrender
news.para: The Supreme Court has denied Dheeraj Wadhawan's request for more time to surrender. He is accused in a major bank loan fraud case. The court had previously cancelled his medical bail. While denying the extension, the court directed authorities to ensure Wadhawan receives regular medical checkups at AIIMS. The Wadhawan brothers are accused of defrauding a consortium of banks.

news.title: Home building permits in Germany rise 7.9% in June as sector wobbles
news.para: German home building permits experienced a 7.9% increase in June compared to the previous year, signaling a potential stabilization in the struggling property sector. However, experts caution against premature optimism, noting that these gains are from historically low levels and insufficient to trigger a significant recovery.

news.title: Units of Knowledge Realty Trust ends with over six per cent premium
news.para: Knowledge Realty Trust, backed by Sattva Group and Blackstone, debuted strongly on the stock exchanges, closing with a premium of over 6% against its issue price of Rs 100 per unit. The IPO, which was oversubscribed by 12.48 times, raised Rs 4,800 crore.

news.title: Omaxe posts net loss of ₹186 crore in Q1 FY26
news.para: Omaxe Ltd reported a consolidated net loss of Rs 185.77 crore in the first quarter of fiscal year 2025-26, attributed to lower income compared to the previous year. Despite the loss, Omaxe acquired 450 acres of land in Indore for a township development with an investment of Rs 1,200 crore and recently raised Rs 500 crore for project development.

news.title: B L Kashyap & Sons' net profit declines 46.39% Q1 FY26
news.para: B.L. Kashyap and Sons experienced a 46.39% decline in net consolidated profit, reporting ₹10.85 crore for Q1 FY26, compared to ₹20.24 crore in the previous year. Despite this dip in profit, the company's total income also saw a slight decrease of 3.85%. However, the company remains optimistic, citing a strong order book and new project wins.

news.title: Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar: CSMC recovers ₹82 crore property tax through amnesty scheme
news.para: Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar Municipal Corporation has prolonged its amnesty scheme. It is for property tax defaulters until August end. The scheme helped recover Rs 82.6 crore. It offered a 95% concession on late payment charges. Over 37,000 property holders benefited.

news.title: Green nod must for Chandigarh civic body's Manimajra housing project
news.para: Chandigarh administration's environment department has mandated a green clearance for Municipal Corporation's housing project in Manimajra. The department communicated that the project falls under Environment Impact Assessment notification. This makes prior environmental clearance necessary.

news.title: Of over seven lakh e-khata applications, only 40,000 pending: Karnataka minister
news.para: Karnataka authorities have significantly reduced e-khata application backlogs, approving 6,53,989 out of 7,00,899 received statewide. Mysuru district approved 62,277 of 72,184 applications. While technical issues caused earlier delays, most have been resolved. Mysuru City Corporation is holding grievance redressal meetings and expects the e-khata drive to improve tax compliance by identifying property discrepancies.

news.title: CAG slams Greater Noida for allowing farmhouses on Hindon floodplain
news.para: The Comptroller and Auditor General criticised Greater Noida Industrial Development Authority. GNIDA permitted construction on the Hindon floodplain. This area was meant for natural conservation. GNIDA introduced farmhouse schemes violating rules.

news.title: Telangana government faces legal hurdles in pushing Future City project
news.para: Telangana government is facing legal challenges with the Bharat Future City Development Authority. The issue is repurposing 20,000 acres initially for Pharma City. The previous government acquired the land. Now, the current government wants to use it for other projects. Farmers are demanding their land back. The industries department is seeking legal and industry expert advice.

news.title: No housing society on government land opts for self-redevelopment in Mumbai
news.para: In Mumbai, no housing societies on government land have chosen self-redevelopment despite a concessional scheme. The scheme, offering a reduced premium for land conversion to freehold, requires societies to undertake redevelopment within two years. High costs, red tape, and corruption deter residents, mostly middle-class or low-income senior citizens, leading to low scheme adoption.

news.title: Goa RERA issues guidelines for builders to refrain from misleading ads
news.para: Goa Real Estate Regulatory Authority has released new guidelines. Builders and realtors cannot use disclaimers in advertisements. Vague mentions of amenities are now misleading. Advertisements must display the Goa Rera registration number. Online portals advertising properties must follow the rules.

news.title: Karnataka RERA restrains Sanchaya Land from creating sale deads, freezes promoters' accounts
news.para: According to the judgment, the developer failed to complete the construction and deliver the flats to the home buyers and also violated the norms.

news.title: Navi Mumbai’s civic body becomes first in country to provide property identity cards to citizens
news.para: Navi Mumbai has become the first municipal corporation in India to launch 'Property Identity Cards' for its property holders. Commissioner Kailas Shinde initiated the program, benefiting over 3.5 lakh owners by providing easy access to property details and tax information. The card streamlines property transactions and facilitates online payments, enhancing transparency and efficiency within the property tax department.

news.title: A bellwether signal? SBI hikes home loan rates by 25 basis points
news.para: State Bank of India and Union Bank of India have increased home loan rates, signaling a potential shift towards higher interest rates in the market, particularly affecting borrowers with lower credit scores. This move comes amid concerns over low-profit margins and increased competition, with private lenders expressing reservations about aggressive pricing strategies employed by public sector banks.

news.title: Delhi: More delay in Signature View Apartments' construction work
news.para: Residents of Delhi's Signature View Apartments, facing imminent demolition, have requested more time to vacate, citing difficulties in finding alternative housing. The RWA has asked for an extension until October 1st, highlighting a previously agreed-upon deadline. While DDA has started compensatory rent for some, a manpower shortage is hindering further agreements.
